document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades PreK - K

F310BC01758F4B499D84E5DA03616971.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading
and being read to, and responding to texts.

149FC3E0D4534677889327BE016F223C.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the
same general action (e.g. walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out
the meanings.

2CD366BA8FC24D2F8C11161DCA2790A0.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

748A29675ADE471CBD29A721A08324EB.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs
and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

406BE10B816845C2BCD40319ECFB54B5.description:
Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to
gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

B60240F1E50C4DBC8CE0929698B31447.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships
and nuances in word meanings.

21D6B5ED49BD447C83B5A5C813FECF4A.description:
Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes
(e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an
unknown word.

F4219A7505DF4720A967674C28B40FFF.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them
accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to
duck).

120B7F902BD3461388D49381EB7F2A71.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple
meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

9F1B8590DFA24238A0EF1C8160F2F01B.description:
Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of
sound-letter relationships.

A914861CADD54064B5900B535C86731C.description:
Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel
sounds (phonemes).

D6315A5973084C6CB96665823DC00941.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

AE8C2E60403449AFB0EB73F9FC4E3947.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2E23471F8EA84F0BB08D7D91D9B10D3B.description:
Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language
activities.

E7157FDD330843909001F6365AE0500F.description:
Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to,
from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

567A954635A746429E2287410259AE0C.description:
Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g.,
who, what, where, when, why, how).

105C2942CC29478BBE22D07762C33CFC.description:
Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g.,
dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

060B108B401044289D6F979F348E25A1.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

70E37217F0794618969F6570BFD37584.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

C2D450B1158E40AFA77AD257EBD0A2D3.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English
grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

A1CD9DFD030743F9B09A0EC349B91E39.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

BDFD8CEBDA6E4A618DB266293790B1D4.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to
provide additional detail.

4F6F04E90482493282BE156E4EA9B6C3.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with
prompting and support, provide additional detail.

4E040830A435415896529C306C6CEEEC.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information,
or clarify something that is not understood.

3C349992C36F44089D493DD1B42163C9.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other media by asking and answering
questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is
not understood.

FA423B50B2D848BFB9C1CA2A175A1B02.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

B8FF1C5AAAF4419B916AFBAE6A408BD5.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to
others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under
discussion).

FF662489D22E438DABE29124986DEC4B.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and
larger groups.

50AE8C7F08C740A08D2BCEF7F222B952.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from
experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a
question.

A332FC4588E94823B64AA4ECAD8603D6.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a
number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

514B770DAEC1412BA72A8E00F31CAE3D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

54EF282F455E4D969FA556F9A2C7DCD0.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of
digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration
with peers.

8C98CB8B82ED4D938F03CAFC7E9D5F4E.description:
With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and
suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

0EA00257136B4971B37205D173E15B70.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a
single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the
order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

5FD8A2B3929E43E4BE1DFB41CC549A0A.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose
informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing
about and supply some information about the topic.

B2FD6402ABA942ABACBF32E84C2108D3.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose
opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the
book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about
the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is...).

6DF2F39C6FA54F46BB18204B3FD90383.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

21723CE1B08844C4B440AD3FBF8177CA.description:
Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying
the sounds of the letters that differ.

A93A1B1A0298483D9AE4786F7B13D306.description:
Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of,
to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

33370B605170408C8E2F6B8DE599F9B7.description:
Associate the long and short sounds with common
spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

F316DA78ADA1420E90511198208D620D.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter- sound
correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.

57EDAE3DA1574811A007C7F4B2BDD382.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

870332F3F18F43BBA0288FC4363A4B78.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple,
one-syllable words to make new words.

C414DA18133B4DA28BDBAA0D663AB955.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final
sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel
consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with
/l/, /r/, or /x/.)

D04629A7F21944A2A31F9B05E5163302.description:
Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable
spoken words.

9D0C251E496E4F9099AC9E65F4CCF372.description:
Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken
words.

FAA81EC9A6C345628EE1000705F9A53E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and
sounds (phonemes).

4D8074883CDA46E8AF8C4BCC773D44B2.description:
Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the
alphabet.

3E5D44441D1A47888628A77F1AA5B19F.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

22CC3735216A4700961A4B4C0246DD64.description:
Recognize that spoken words are represented in written
language by specific sequences of letters.

E8002CD0169443329E99F00478303D2C.description:
Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by
page.

8E8F7B887178471DA23AA7C12E82490B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic
features of print.

50222025392647269A07B859C8B83AEB.description:
Actively engage in-group reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

8F3FC5B0C3DA4F78A85AEA2A3A0CAA1C.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

ED2A69BE39F6409A8D0273A163C3E3EC.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between
illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place,
thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

FBA5FDA0E1644A6CBDE36718AC92C31B.description:
With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives
to support points in a text.

BB2986731C6B4059B5115C9A6E0E7FA8.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between
illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place,
thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

43AA7BA1295D4B6A97E46770B5924AFA.description:
Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of
each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

CA538A9559D140FBAAA21EBF170A3FDA.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

C6ACF5E125DA418B9CE3DE9196589D17.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
unknown words in a text.

801B0CC3C3234628B402A19EC09AD4FF.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection between
two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

A5DBEBD1E9C84DF7B8ABD3858AE2B693.description:
With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell
key details of a text.

97E673D3DCB04318B8B3338C955B4E7E.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key
ideas in a text.

B1BFACF81B9445CBBF1EA8CCAC3AC639.description:
Actively engage in-group reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

199FA1B9C5334402A31C9BF59D0D3A29.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

06B8A52C60BA4E228C14F41EB4476663.description:
With prompting and support, compare and contrast the
adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

A50D5C31B81F4732AA36394119ABF084.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between
illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a
story an illustration depicts).

588A80B9E09949B38CDBE31D796E6175.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a
story and define the role of each in telling the story.

D95BC06BD34C40A980012F073D71D30A.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

AAA8973C1CEB410587F66BF64251A16A.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

40A80E792867455582F187A337347D76.description:
With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and
major events in a story.

E732122D69F7405C9AE8F37272CF1E9B.description:
With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key
details.

6312E4FC964F435DAA56795B9503218D.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key
details in a text.
